inlineContent.text: A map item includes a geographic location and any interesting data that might apply to that location, such as the address at that location and the name of a business at that address. You can also create a special
Use this class to do the following:
Share map-related data with the Maps app.
Handle requests for directions that originate from the Maps app.
To display information in the Maps app, create an
object with the information you want to display and call the
method. The Maps app displays that location on the map and shows the information you provide.
If you implement a routing app, the Maps app provides two
objects representing the start and end points. Use the information in those two objects to plot the route and generate directions.

abstract.text: Display map or satellite imagery within your app, call out points of interest, and determine placemark information for map coordinates.

abstract.text: Launch options to specify when opening map items in the Maps app.
The root class of most Objective-C class hierarchies, from which subclasses inherit a basic interface to the runtime system and the ability to behave as Objective-C objects.
A protocol that enables an object to be encoded and decoded for archiving and distribution.
The protocol for implementing a class to allow an item provider to create an instance of the class.
The protocol for implementing a class to allow an item provider to retrieve data from an instance of the class.
The group of methods that are fundamental to all Objective-C objects.
A protocol that enables encoding and decoding in a manner that is robust against object substitution attacks.
A type that can be hashed into a `Hasher` to produce an integer hash value.
A type that can be compared for value equality.
A type with a customized textual representation.
A type with a customized textual representation suitable for debugging purposes.
A type whose instances can be encoded, and appropriately passed, as elements of a C `va_list`.
A type whose values can be implicitly or explicitly copied.
